document.masterDocTitle: Apionidae, Nanophyidae, Brachyceridae and Curculionidae except Scolytinae (Coleoptera) from Socotra Island

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Apionidae, Nanophyidae, Brachyceridae and Curculionidae except Scolytinae (Coleoptera) from Socotra Island

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material examined.
LECTOTYPE (here designated): J ( 4.5 mm , MLUH ), ‘ Wadi Kischen // 25.’ [handwritten]
, ‘ Lectotypus ♂ //
Systates angusticollis Taschenberg, 1883
// E.Colonnelli des., 2012’ [red, partly printed], ‘ Socotractus // angusticollis Taschenberg // E. Colonnelli det., 2012’ [white, partly printed]. The specimen ( Fig. 85 ) is placed after the collection label of Fig. 87 , and although TASCHENBERG (1883) in the original description did not report any locality, it actually comes from ‘Wadi Kischen’ ( Fig. 86 ), presently wadi Qishn, ( 12º34′N , 54º02′E ).

Material examined ( 318 spec. ).
YEMEN :
SOCOTRA ISLAND :
Al Haghier Mts. , Scant Mt. env., 12°34.6′N 54°01.5′E ,
1450 m
,
12.–13.xi.2010
, 91 spec. , P. Hlaváč leg. (87 NMPC 4 ECRI )
;
same label data, 22 spec. , J. Bezděk leg. (20 NMPC , 2 ECRI )
;

, 1 spec. , P. Kabátek leg. ( NMPC )
.

Taxonomy. This species is here moved from
Systates Gerstaecker, 1871
to
Socotractus
gen. nov. as
Socotractus angusticollis ( Taschenberg, 1883 )
, comb. nov. , and selected as the type species of
Socotractus
gen. nov.

Variability. It appears to be a rather common weevil in the mountain range of Socotra , the variation of which, apart from the size, is rather low. Males have depressed elytra with almost even intervals, whereas females ( Fig. 89 ) have feebly convex elytra and intervals with more or less developed, but always visible blunt tubercles on apical third.
Male genitalia. Aedeagus as depicted in Fig. 88 .

Collection circumstances. The species is very common on
Leucas hagghierensis Al-Gifri & Cortés-Burns
( Lamiaceae ) in Hagher mountains (J. Hájek, pers. comm.). One specimen was collected on
Cephalocroton socotranus Balf.
f. ( Euphorbiaceae ).
